item.title: Report E-2023100409
item.description:
Report E-2023100409

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As the drum was being moved on the dock, it was punctured by a forklift fork. The drum was immediately placed into an overpack drum to contain the compromised drum. the released material was neutralized and absorbed using absorbent material. The absorbed material was also placed into a proper disposal container for proper disposal. Due to the hazard of material, the packaging specs were not able to be safely obtained.

item.title: Report E-2023100243
item.description:
Report E-2023100243

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: UHRICHSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XUR experienced an approximate 1-cup release of UN3084 Kleen MCT411 from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and advised terminal personnel conducted cleanup and placed the damaged pail of product into a 35-gallon metal drum. The pail and material released were correctly containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The 35-gallon empty contaminated metal drum was placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2023090877

  • City: PERRYSBURG

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found 9/14 at 6:40pm in the unload area and was brought to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Carton was wet due to inner containers having loose caps resulting in internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE was used to contain package in a plastic hazmat bag which was then placed in a plastic tote.

item.title: Report X-2023091071
item.description:
Report X-2023091071

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A PACKAGE THAT HAD A POWDER SUBSTANCE SPILL OUT. PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A L INED TOTE. DescribePack: UNDECLARED PACKAGE. NO DIAMOND OR HAZMAT SERVICE CODE. INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKING ALLOWED MOVEMENT. THIS ALLOWED PIN TO FALL OUT AND DRY CHEMICAL RELEASE TO OCCUR. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023090855
item.description:
Report X-2023090855

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: CAMBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package came down to route and when package handler picked up the pail by the handle, the handle failed and the container dropped to the floor - management and myself isolated the area and used floor dri and cat litter to contain and clean up the spill DescribePack: package dropped and bottom of 5 gallon plastic pail cracked open and leaked out contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Floor dri and cat litter used to absorb and contain the liquid that was spilled

item.title: Report X-2023090667
item.description:
Report X-2023090667

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE CAP WAS LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN, SOILING OTHER PRODUCTS IN PACKAGE DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER SPILLAGE

item.title: Report E-2023100435
item.description:
Report E-2023100435

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: ASHTABULA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During transit the driver had to stop the truck at the side of the road while on I90 on Ohio near Ashtabula. He found that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of Methyl ethyl ketone peroxide (un3105) had fallen and had contractors dispatched to clean up and contain the 2 gallon release from one of the inner poly 2.5 gallon jug.

item.title: Report E-2023100382
item.description:
Report E-2023100382

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the 1853 pound poly super sack of copper sulfate (un3077) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 12 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023100223
item.description:
Report E-2023100223

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 27, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3098 was dropped by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed poly sheeting, pH neutralizers, soda ash, granular absorbents, and pad absorbents to theUN3098-impacted areas and collected them with hand tools. TLE personnel cut out the impacted wood debris from the trailer and after collection of waste and debris flushed the trailer. All spent absorbents and debris were collected into two (2) lined 35-gallon poly drums, one with the impacted, diluted pail inside and the other with miscellaneous waste and debris, along with a lined 55-gallon poly drum containing mixed waste and cleanup debris.
